question:
Consider the following statements about the terms “Kepler-80g” and “Kepler-90i” that were recently making in news:
  1. These are extra-solar planets recently discovered by Indian Space Research Organisation
  2. These are the closest known exoplanets to earth discovered so far
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: First statement is incorrect Recently, on December 14, NASA announced that it has discovered two new exoplanets with a little help from Google. The scientists used the artificial intelligence technology from Google to analyse the data from Kepler- a telescope placed in space. Kepler-80g was found in the planetary system around Kepler 80. The other exoplanet Kepler-90i was found orbiting Kepler 90. An extrasolar or exoplanet is a planet outside of our solar system that orbits a star. Second statement is again incorrect While Kepler 90 star is 2722 light years away, Kepler 80 is a star about 1364 light years away. Proxima b is the closest known exoplanet to Earth, located nearly 4.2 light-years away from earth.
